wikitext.*:
'''brethil''' is a [[Sindarin]] word meaning "beech-tree",<ref name=Ety>{{HM|LR}} "[[The Etymologies]]"</ref> "silver birch".<ref>{{S|Appendix}}</ref><ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, pp. 19, 23, 82</ref> 
*'''Examples:'''
**''[[Brethil]]''
**''[[Nimbrethil]]''
**''[[Fimbrethil]]''
The 'ordinary' Sindarin word for birch was [[chwind]] or [[chwind|whinn]].<ref name=PE17/>
==Etymology==
''brethil'' is derived from the [[Sundocarmë|root]] [[BERÉTH]],<ref name=Ety/> and is probably related to [[Gnomish]] ''bridh(n)ir'' ("queen, princess").<ref name=PE17/><ref>{{PE|11}}</ref>
==Notes==
The word should not be related to ''brethil'' "daughter of the Queen; princess"<ref name=PE17/> which obviously derives from ''[[bereth]]'' (root [[BARAT]]).
